summary: This document is email correspondence between defense attorney Christian Everdell and an Assistant United States Attorney regarding discovery issues in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. It details defense requests for missing Bates-stamped documents, metadata corrections, and clarifications on evidence production, including references to FBI reports and evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's devices.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell, corresponding with prosecutors about discovery requests and missing evidence.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Copied on discovery correspondence, part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in relation to documents recovered from his devices during FBI searches.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Individual who provided documents (flight logs) via subpoena to the prosecution.

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced discovery materials to the defense, referenced as the "11/9 production."

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced additional discovery materials, including a CD and documents from specific subject devices.

events.title: Discovery Production
events.description: The government produced documents including those from David Rodgers and search warrant filings from the District of New Hampshire.

events.title: FBI Report
events.description: An FBI report dated December 6, 2006, was recovered from one of Jeffrey Epstein's devices and produced in discovery with existing redactions.

events.title: Sealing Order Expiration
events.description: A sealing order for search warrant filings in the District of New Hampshire automatically expired, leading to their unsealing.

keyFacts: The defense identified missing Bates-stamped document ranges (e.g., SDNY_GM_00167911 through SDNY_GM_00168477) that were agreed to be reproduced but not received.
An FBI report from December 6, 2006 (Bates SDNY_GM_02050812-14) was recovered from Jeffrey Epstein's devices with pre-existing redactions; the prosecution states they did not apply any redactions.
Flight logs were produced by David Rodgers via subpoena, but the defense notes an apparent gap (Rodgers000001-000027) in the production.
The defense raised concerns about a Daily Beast article referencing an unsealed search warrant affidavit for a cell-site simulator used to track Ghislaine Maxwell before her arrest.
The prosecution confirmed that search warrant filings from the District of New Hampshire were unsealed automatically per a court order, not by affirmative action of their office.
